Would definitely recommend staying here.
Great apartment. Clean and cosy. Only issue was noisy air conditioning unit next to the bed.
Lisa was an amazing host!
Idéal pour la découverte de Manhattan très bien

Not recommended for the first time in NY. Pros very silent, close to city bike rental Cons 4th floor and no elevator, all NY attractions far from the house and underground and buses lines with manu changes to reach them, sheets and pillows as towels not clean, make sure to bring towels and also your hair dryer, consider that there is no flexibility in the check out and make your plans accordingly.

Great location: subway is very close or an easy 15 minute stroll into the heart of SoHo.

Excellent amenities & super tidy!

L'appartement était au calme, dans un quartier où il fait bon manger des brunchs ou dîner le soir en rentrant de sa folle journée new-yorkaise. Dommage que certains petits conforts ne soient pas au rendez-vous et qu'on trouve pourtant dans des Airbnb au même prix dans le quartier : comme le thé et le café (ici inexistant), ou surtout des serviettes de bain décentes (ici des serviettes certes propres mais vieilles et tachées), du papier toilette et en bonne quantité (ici 2,5 rouleaux pour 2 pour 7 jours) et un vrai ensemble savon/douche (ici quelques mini flacons type hôtel deci-delà). Ce sont ces petits détails qui font se sentir vraiment bien d'avoir choisi ce Airbnb ou un autre. A vous de voir si cela vous convient où si vous préférez tenter votre chance ailleurs.

We loved staying in Lisa's apartment, east village is such a great location, heaps of bars and restaurants just walking distance and it was nice after a long day out to come back to comfortable bed. Definitely recommend staying here.
Lisa's place is a great base to explore New York. Also a wonderful area for bars and restaurants in the evening.

El alojamiento de Lisa es realmente bueno al igual que su predisposición para dar respuesta a las consultas. 
El barrio es lindo, silencioso y a la vez tranquilo como para poder moverse de noche, pero con algunos lugares nocturnos para comer y tomar algo.

A pocas cuadras está el Metro F que permite acceder al centro de Manhattan rápido y sin problemas.

En cuanto el departamento, es muy lindo, con todo lo que uno necesita para disfrutar de la estancia en NY. 

Un punto a mejorar es el colchón que era demasiado blando y si uno no está acostumbrado dificulta la dormida.

Para los que tengan pensado manejar muchas valijas, sepan que es en un cuarto piso por escalera empinada!

La verdad que volveríamos a lo de Lisa, tanto por el departamento como por su predisposición!

Saludos!
Lisa's place is lovely and she was a great host, available and flexible. I highly recommend her place!
Great host... responds quickly and very helpful. We had a great stay.
Great Location, Cozy Place for staying, easy access to amenities,  timely communication by host
Lisa was a lovely host, she was very helpfull in all our needs. The apartment was in a great and fun neighbourhood. Really nice place to stay!
First airbnb. Busy two weeks in NYC for work/school, and the apartment was a perfect choice for me. Lisa was super responsive and very helpful as well.

All excellent! Served us well, great restaurants and bars surrounding or just a few blocks away. Great central location for sight seeing, we did a lot of walking per day, but that’s just how we like it! 
Plenty of transport on offer if required.

Great value for money. Great location and quick responses from Lisa. 

The only downfall is a lack of airflow in the flat. You cannot open the windows. The air in the bedroom/kitchen is very still and can get very hot. There is AC which cools the space down quickly but it is very very loud.

But like I said value for money. Pay more if you want a nicer space.
Lisa’s place is quiet, private, clean, comfortable and homely, and nicely located in a vibrant and eclectic neighbourhood. A great experience.
Good place and great location

We loved our month-long stay at Lisa's place. Even though the Lower East Side can get pretty hectic, it was nice to go back to a quiet and cozy apartment. Lisa is a very attentive and responsive host, and was particularly responsive around check-in and check-out. The only thing to look out for (and Lisa mentions this accurately in her description) is that the apartment is pretty far from any subway line. Not too bad once you get the hang of it -- and there are a few buses in the area -- but if you're planning on traveling by subway while in the city, it's worth thinking about. Otherwise, it's an awesome spot, and the neighborhood is great. We would definitely go back!
Great apartment. Very clean and on a top notch location. We didn't meet Lisa, but she kept in touch via text message so we felt very welcome.

great apartment! super cute and very very clean. looks exactly like the pictures and Lisa was such a wonderful host. she was super communicative and understanding of our late check out. her apartment is really a gem

Apartamento correcto por el precio (que ya da a entender que va a ser pequeñito), pero muy mal ventilado y mucho menos luminoso que lo que se ve en la foto.  En cuanto a la zona, es un barrio muy multicultural y tan variopinto como el mismo Nueva York: edificios ruinosos y llenos de pintadas al lado de bloques reconstruidos y ocupados por parejas jóvenes de buen poder adquisitivo. Y por último, el encargado de asistir a los huéspedes (que no la propietaria) es un chico encantador que ayuda a resolver cualquier problema.

Good stay! Place was very clean and the location was great, ideally located in the East Village, in a quiet street not far from nice restaurants and bars.  The subway is about 15 minutes walk away, but there are bus stops very close, and exploring NYC on foot is a must. Liza was very easy to get in touch with and checking in and out was very easy.
We had a great stay at Lisa’s place! A nice and clean apartment, great hospitality and fast respons from Lisa.
Great little apartment, quirky and cute, about a 15 min walk to the subway.
Excelente apartamento, buena ubicación y muy limpio!
Very clean, cozy, and quiet space. Check-in was easy and Lisa was very responsive and helpful. The location is great - lots to walk to.
Lisa's apartment was perfect for our stay in New York. Wonderfully located and incredibly comfortable. Lisa was a great host as well, with super quick responses. Thanks!

Appartement calme, hyper bien placé. Il y a des commerces partout autour
Très pratique pour se déplacer à pied ou à vélo dans Manathan.
Je conseille

Lisa's place is perfect for a couple : perfectly located with all the stuff you may need in the kitchen and in the bathroom.  But note that it's a bit hard to find the supermarket where the keys are waiting for you 0.5 mile away from Lisas's building ! It's pretty far away by feet and almost impossible to find without an internet connection and a GPS! Hopefully our Uber driver accepted to drop us there before coming back to Lisa's. Moreover you need a code to get the keys that you may receive during your flight... so once again, you will need an internet connection after your arrival to get this code. Not very convenient for a foreigner.

L’appartement était conforme à l’annonce, Lisa était très disponible pour toutes informations supplémentaires ! Le lit est magique et parfait après une journée de visite ! Nous avons passé un agréable séjour dans cette appartement, encore merci !

name: CENTRAL PARK, NYC APT
summary: This conveniently located Upper West side & w80s NYC apt consists of a private bedroom with a queen sized bed, fresh linen, wi fi, wall closets, shelf space & tv, table, 2 chairs, kitchen, bathroom, etc & in a spacious space, only a few steps to Central Park
space: There is a seperate small kitchen with a fridge, small stove and pot/pans and plates/silverware, coffee maker & electric kettle to make tea or coffee. The bathroom has a shower for use only as the tub needs updating. The building is situated only a few steps to citibikes, bike shops/trails, Metropolition Museum of Art (about a 4 min walk across Central Park) & The Natural History Museum is just 2  blocks away from apt. The entrance to Central park is at the end of my block on central park west & always has free concerts, a children's zoo, historical monuments, bike trails and boating, etc. An ideal stay in an exclusive & convenient location... come explore!
description: This conveniently located Upper West side & w80s NYC apt consists of a private bedroom with a queen sized bed, fresh linen, wi fi, wall closets, shelf space & tv, table, 2 chairs, kitchen, bathroom, etc & in a spacious space, only a few steps to Central Park There is a seperate small kitchen with a fridge, small stove and pot/pans and plates/silverware, coffee maker & electric kettle to make tea or coffee. The bathroom has a shower for use only as the tub needs updating. The building is situated only a few steps to citibikes, bike shops/trails, Metropolition Museum of Art (about a 4 min walk across Central Park) & The Natural History Museum is just 2  blocks away from apt. The entrance to Central park is at the end of my block on central park west & always has free concerts, a children's zoo, historical monuments, bike trails and boating, etc. An ideal stay in an exclusive & convenient location... come explore! Guests can help themselves to tea or coffee in the mornings, unlimited wifi
neighborhood_overview: Museum of Natural History, Prohibition (Live music every night), Dessert places like Momofuko, Cotta, and Sarabeths. Grocery stores like Trader Joes, Gristedes & Fairway. Restaurants such as Good Enough to Eat, Cotta, Cafe 82, clothing stores like Brooks Brothers, Banana Republic & Victoria's Secret, boutiques such as Ricky's, Origins & Blue Mercury are close also. Here is an awesome airbnb link about this area to learn more: https://www.airbnb.com/locations/new-york/upper-west-side
notes: No baths. Bathroom has shower use only. The guest room fully opens & closes with ceiling to floor curtains instead of walls & doors to add more space, air & light. Ideal for light travelers...
transit: 1 block away is the a, b, c, 2 blocks away is the 1 train. There is a bike rental (only $7 an hour any day of the week), citibike rentals ($12 a day) a block away and around the corner is the crosstown bus to take you to the East side and of course, there are taxis everywhere! JFK & LaGuardia airports are 30-40 minutes away by train or car.
access: Guests can help themselves to tea or coffee in the mornings, unlimited wifi,  & a comfy relaxed simple space in the heart of the city
interaction: Communicating through the airbnb app is always the best way to reach me. Starbucks has wifi & is a block away if you are running late & can only reach me through the airbnb app...this is just for those from outside the US who dont have long distance. If you do have any phone service, just call:)
house_rules: Coordinating an approximate arrival time  by messaging me when you're on the way with at least 1 hour notice. My job takes me all over the city, & I need 1-2 hours  to leave & meet you with a key or arrange a key pick up location with you if I am not there. Required for booking: please provide a brief purpose of trip explanation & have several past airbnb reviews as that is a requirement. Female guests can only be accommodated at this time due to construction & layout of apt as both bedrooms although divided by sitting room are sectioned off with ceiling to floor curtains rather then doors that allow for more light & air (see photos attached). Pets, visitors, drinking & smoking are never allowed. Please have a clear profile photo with your face so I can recognize & identify and at least 4-5 verifications along with several past airbnb reviews as this is required at all times prior to booking.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Love hiking, music, live bands and traveling!

reviews.comments: Philomena is a great host, caring and a cool person to talk to. I had an amazing time. The Upper West Side is definitely one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in NYC and the apartment is close to Central Park. The apartment itself is clean and cozy. The bar next-door might get bit noisy on some evenings, but with earplugs I had a very good sleep.
The reservation was canceled 38 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Phil was very flexible and welcoming despite my late arrival, and made me feel like I was coming back to an old friend (I've never met her before). She went above and beyond to provide everything I could possibly expect out of a stay, and was up front about anything that might otherwise had been a surprise. The room is little more than floor-to-ceiling curtains fully surrounding a bed and some space for a suitcase - but that's all I needed, and what she set me up to expect.
At night there was quite a bit of noise from a band playing in the building and from street through the open window, but I am not sensitive to that, so it did not bother me or prevent me from getting sleep. It is just something to be aware of. 
Overall, this experience was a fantastic value for the location and the service and flexibility provided by the hostess. Will seriously consider coming back here on my next visit to the city! I left Phil's apartment not only feeling like I had visited a friend, but actually having one for real.

Philomena was an excellent host! We traveled by Greyhound, and she was able to tell us how to get to her place with ease (as Manhattan can be a difficult place). Philomena was a great communicator and was able to accommodate our business schedules. Her recommendation on places to eat around the neighborhood as well as in the "city" was top-notch. The bed was nice, and the "room" had plenty of space to hang up my suits and clothes. It can be a little noisy with the outside windows up at night; however, the noise was less than nothing when the windows were down. The building is a little old so it may feel a little stuffy at times, but this was easy corrected with a passive, noise cancellation fan by the bed that she provided. I would recommend Philomena's place for anyone who wants easy access to the subway, a block away from Central Park, and likes to be in an area recognized as Manhattan's most prosperous neighborhoods.

Phil tries to accommodate the guest as best as she can. She's also a very interesting person to talk to. 
My stay was pleasant. The bed and the space were very nice. The neighborhood is safe and has a lot to offer. Would definitely recommend this space to anyone who's looking for a relatively cheap place in a good neighborhood in the city.

Philomena's place is in a perfect location. It was easy to get to multiple subway lines, including uptown and downtown, Central Park and Museum Mile. Her apartment was clean, comfortable and in a great neighborhood. She provided food for breakfast and bathroom amenities. I really enjoyed my time at her place and getting to know her for a couple of days. Made for an enjoyable NYC experience :)

Meena is the absolute best.  I truly felt like she rolled out the red carpet for me .  My stay there rivaled a high end hotel but even better because of her warm personality.  This was only my second trip with Airbnb.  Meena is the type of host that makes you come and back. I feel like I got all the company promised and more

I'm very glad I stayed at Mena's place.  First, Mena herself is lovely!  She has a very easy, friendly manner, and it was great to chat with her each day.  She keeps her apartment beautifully, and everything was very comfortable.  She also loves oatmeal, as do I, so I had a great breakfast each day before heading off to my conference.  I was working at the American Museum of Natural History, and it could not have been an easier place to stay - I just walked a few blocks there and back.  The neighborhood is very safe, with plenty of restaurants and other amenities - and the park is right there!  

Mena also has thought through how to make the stay comfortable, and to work through any contingencies to be sure I had everything I needed.  If I need to come another time to NYC, I'd certainly check to see if she has space and stay here again!

Mena's apartment was exactly as pictured and in an excellent location -easy access to both the subway and central park and I felt very comfortable and safe in her neighborhood. The room is less a private room than a nook in a studio apartment, but she has set it up nicely with a curtain so there is certainly an added degree of privacy. Mena was very friendly and helpful. For a weekend in nyc, i'm not sure you could do any better for the price!
My second stay with Mena was just a fabulous as the first.  She by far the best stay I have had with Airbnb

The apartment was in a very good location. Very close to Central Park and the subway. It was perfect to have this as a base for traveling around Manhattan.  

Mena was also an excellent host. She sorted me out with what I needed and was happy to answer all my questions. Very outgoing and kind. 

Highly recommend this place for a trip to NYC!

This was my first time using Airbnb and I couldn't have been more pleased with my experience. Mena's place is in a great location close to everything. The space is a little bigger in person than it looks in the photo on the site, and it's clean and neat. It felt cozy and private when the curtains were drawn and the bed was so comfortable. Mena provided thoughtful touches such as toiletries, an iron and ironing board, and a sound machine to help mask the street sounds at night. I didn't need it; I was so exhausted each day that I fell asleep quite easily, but if you are very sensitive to noises it is there and available for your use. You can hear music from a bar and the radiators hiss when they kick in, but again, it didn't bother me at all - but if you are a person who needs silence to sleep then you will need the sound machine or ear plugs (and you aren't going to get 100% silence anywhere in NYC, even if you stay in a hotel!) Mena was a great host. She was very welcoming and I had a lot of fun talking and going out walking with her. I felt quite safe in the area. Mena's space is perfect if you are going to be out and about most of the day and want a good "home base" location. I hope to return.

Mena was a great host and her location is fantastic. The upper west side is an amazing neighborhood and her place is less than a 5 minute walk to the subway line that can get you all over the city. Highly recommend!

Philomena is very friendly. She keeps her place tidy and clean. It was bigger than I had imagined before coming to New York. I absolutely loved Upper West Side. It was beautiful, convenient and super safe even for a female solo traveller at midnight or early morning. The bed was very comfortable. Thanks Phil for my first Airbnb experience. Fantastic times.

Mena is a lovely lady and excellent host. Her apartment is beautiful & welcoming and very organized & clean. I love how the space is set up and I was very comfortable. The location is one of my favorites in town-- very close to great restaurants, coffee shops and Central Park. Thank you Mena for being so sweet and helpful! <3

Mena was an incredible host for my first Airbnb experience. Quick to respond, she answered all my questions and has fantastic knowledge of the city and the UWS. Her home was exactly as described and has a wonderful warm vibe to it. I normally don't sleep well in new places but had the best sleep of my life. Bed was comfy and warm. From this point forward, anytime I come into Manhattan, I plan to stay here. The location is fantastic! Close to Central Park, close to museums, great restaurants nearby, transportation is easy from her place (not hard to catch a cab or take the subway). Love, love love it and wish I would of had more time but I will be back. Thanks Airbnb and Mena for such a memorable and incredible experience.

Mena is an excellent and really amazing host. She has a wonderful spirit and it was not just nice to stay with her but also to meet her and being able to have some awesome conversations! It was so great to arrive at her place at the Upper West Side, which is the perfect place to stay when you are visiting New York City! Mena gave me some nice tips and was very generous with her place. She has a lovely apartment and everything is just as in the pictures shown if not even better!!! The location of her place is also wonderful, as you can walk there easily to Central Park and all major Metro lines are within minutes away. This is FIVE STAR AirBnB accommodation at its very best and I highly recommend it to everyone! I can't wait to be back! Mena, see you very soon!!!
Mina was a fine host!

This was my first experience with Airbnb and it was a pleasant one. Mena was very welcoming and considerate and answered my questions before and during my stay. The room was clean and cosy and provided all I needed for my stay. The location itself was good, safe and waking distance to the subway. 

I had a great time in NYC and I can totally recommend this place to all my friends. 
Thanks again Mena :)

Staying at Mena's worked out perfectly for our last minute trip. She was super accommodating in getting us the keys when it worked for us and making sure we had towels and everything we needed. Her apartment was really easy to get to on the Subway and in a great spot on the UWS, really close to Central Park. The bed and blankets were super comfy and warm, really nice to come back to late each night, and the shower was awesome too - both critical when staying out of town! We enjoyed chatting with her on our last day as well.

This was a great place to stay in NY! The apt had all the essentials, and was clean and warm (including a good shower!). Mena was also super nice and interesting to talk to. Close to public transportation which was super convenient!
The reservation was canceled 40 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
This was our first experience with airbnb and Mena made it an excellent one. She thought of everything to make our visit smooth and comfortable!

Mena's apartment enjoys one of the best locations in Manhattan. It's right next to center park, walking distance to museums and close to subway station, where I could easily go to middle town. Actually I walked back and forth to east side through the park and it was really a good experience. Besides that, It is also a very safe neighborhood. I came back in midnight and didn't worry about safety. Eating around is convenient too. There is a grocery store and a few highly rated (Yelp) restaurants right in the corner. 

I stayed with Mena for four nights and she is a great hostess. Apartment is clean and tidy. Mena is very detail oriented and provided every little this and that to make my stay comfortable. She even turned on the air conditioner for me so I came back with a cooler space in a hot/humid summer night.

One more thing to mention is that when I came in the city I was more than one hour late than the time I informed her. But she's very patiently waiting for me and helped me check-in before she left for her own errands.

In all, it is a very nice stay and I enjoyed my stay with Mena. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who'd like to stay in the city.
Mena has thought of everything to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Immaculately clean, privacy, all necessary amenities are provided! I would definitely return here on my next visit to NY!

The apartment room was comfortable and pleasant. Mena was friendly and very accommodating and not around much so I  felt like I had the place to myself which I appreciated since my trip was stressful. The bed was comfortable and overall it was a great place to stay. Thanks Mena!

Mena so incredibly kind! She had everything ready for my arrival and looked after me with a wonderful breakfast the next morning. She even was so kind as to help me with my bags to my next place. Could not recommend staying with her highly enough. X

I had a lovely stay at Mena's charming Upper West Side apartment! The location couldn't have been better. I could run to Central Park in 5 minutes, my favorite cafe in 3, and the subway station was just around the corner. She was an excellent hostess, very helpful and hospitable! I enjoyed my stay and would absolutely stay here again! Thanks Mena!

Mena was a fantastic host! Communication was quick, easy, and efficient (before, during, and after). Getting keys and returning keys was a very simple and easy process. 
Mena was great to chat with when we were both around. She's very friendly and will give advice on where to visit, what to do, how to get around. I felt very welcomed in her home and very comfortable. 
The space was exactly as shown. It was very clean, the bed is very comfy, and fresh towels were always supplied! The curtains around the bed give privacy when you want it. 
As I was there in the summer, it was really warm outside. Mena kept the air on when needed and there's a nice fan beside to bed. Outside can sometimes get a little noisy at night (as it will just about anywhere you stay in NY!), but with the fan next to me or earphones/plugs in, the noise is gone. 
The location is perfect and it's easy to get to anywhere you need to be. Central Park is a block away and is perfect to go for a run or cut across to go to the Metropolitan museum. Other Museums, operas, or shows are a short walk or bus ride away. The subway and bus stations are within a block or two. There are a ton of stores and restaurants right outside the doorstep.
 
This was my first Airbnb experience and Mena was the perfect host for this. I highly recommend staying here to anyone, and if I'm ever in the area I will be sure to stay here again!

Thank you Mena for everything!

Mena's apartment was absolutely perfect for my stay in New York.  It was a centralized location with good air conditioning - my little oasis in the city.  Mena was welcoming when I saw her but most of the time our schedules didn't match up.
ﾁｪｯｸｲﾝ時間を早めてもらえないか､連絡したところ､快く調整をしてくれて非常に助かりました｡最後の日も鍵を返した後にｼｬﾜｰを貸してくれたり､とても親切でﾌﾚﾝﾄﾞﾘｰで感謝しています｡お部屋も清潔で可愛らしく必要なものはすべて揃っていて､ていねいな説明もしてくれました｡ｾﾝﾄﾗﾙﾊﾟｰｸまでとても近くて毎日公園に行きました｡素敵なｶﾌｪも多く､また滞在したいです｡

This was my very first Airbnb experience. Mena was a wonderful and thoughtful host. It was a pleasure talking to her in the evenings after a whole day of NY sightseeing. Check in and out was super easy. She always checked on me to make sure I had everything I needed. The apartment looked exactly like in the photos. I traveled solo and I felt very safe walking alone in this neighborhood. It is right next to the NY Central Park. The description of the place is very accurate. The internet was fast, the bed was fresh and comfortable, the  shared bathroom was always available for my use.  Although I did not cook, the kitchen was also available in case I wanted to prepare a meal. Thank you, Mena, for your hospitality!
The host canceled this reservation 29 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I had a wonderful time at Mena's (Website hidden by Airbnb) has a perfect location,very close from the subway and a lot of nice restaurants.The bed is very (Website hidden by Airbnb) was so nice to stay there.
Thanks Mena

Mena was a lovely hostess - very accommodating with my arrival & departure schedule, which I really appreciated.  Although this apartment is really one large room, she has creatively curtained off a sleeping area and a sitting area with sofa bed, for some privacy for one or more guests, as well as her own personal space.  It was acceptable for me since I ended up coming alone, however I believe listings should make clear whether apartments contain separate enclosed bedrooms or just have some type of dividers, i.e., semi-private.  There were some thoughtful touches (notions, lamps, fan, plus the clean linens) in the sleeping area, and oatmeal & coffee were prepared the first morning, and available for the second.  The bathroom is very small but everything worked.  I was just disappointed that it hadn't been cleaned.  The location of this apartment a block from Central Park and walking distance to Riverside Park and the Hudson jogging/biking paths, plus shopping, cafes/restaurants, public transportation (directions were precise), and museums on the UWS can hardly be better!  Mena indicated she can also give bike tours of the area.  I had other plans, but as Mena is an articulate, vivacious, and energetic young woman, being guided by her would certainly be a plus for anyone wanting to take advantage of that offer!

Listing description and photos are accurate. The unit itself is old but was clean. Communication with Mena was easy and she was prompt. Great UWS location close to the subway at 86 on central park, and close to a large grocery store and restaurants.

Die Unterkunft ist wirklich klasse, kann ich jedem nur weiterempfehlen!
Mena ist ein wirklich ein toller Mensch, sympathisch, nett und sehr hilfsbereit.
Die Lage der Wohnung ist echt super in der UWS, vor allem wenn man den Central Park besuchen will. Subway und Busse fahren gleich um die Ecke, sodass man problemlos überall hinkommt. Kleine Supermärkte, Cafés, Restaurants, Dehlis etc. sind auch gleich nebenan.
Die Wohnung ist schön, das Bett sehr bequem! Und der Kaffee morgens ist echter Kaffee, wie wir Deutsche ihn lieben :)
Ich kann die Unterkunft nur weiter empfehlen und wenn ich wieder mal in New York bin bestimmt wieder bei Mena anfragen.
A very unforgettable experience. First time using Airbnb. That was fun. Mena was a nice host. The location of the apt is super convenient. Recommend for visitors!
It was a great pleasure staying at Mena's place. Perfect location, and nice cozy room. Mena is a wonderful host.

Mena's place is excellently located in the Upper West Side, just a block from Central Park and close to numerous subway lines. She had everything prepared and communication was very easy. 
One note that the bed is curtained off from the rest of the apartment but isn't a separate room per se. There is plenty of privacy and the experience was great.

ついた日が遅かったのですが､連絡もすぐ取れてよかったです｡
場所はとても安全で､素敵なﾛｹｰｼｮﾝでした｡
Nice cozy room in the Upper West Side, just a block from Central Park and close to many cafes and restaurants.

The apt is perfectly located, close to 2 subway stations, Central Park and lots of restaurants and cafes. It is exactly as described. Outside it can sometimes get a little noisy at night as there is a pub with occasionally live music. Mena is a great hostess, check in and out was super easy. The first couple of days our schedules didn't match up but she always checked on me if I had everything I needed. And as we finally met she prepared a very yummy breakfast.

Men's home was tidy and clean and I was very comfortable staying there.  Our hours were very different as she left early inn the morning and I would wake later in the morning.  She was home later in the evening because of work - but often I was out and home just before she was.  I was comfortable as I came and went as I pleased and was very independent.   
Arrival was arranged for me to pick up the key.
Her apartment was very handy for walking to the subway and also to many great little restaurants close by.

Mena was a very gracious and accommodating host! The apartment photos and description are very accurate. The neighborhood is ideal for running in Central Park, experiencing a variety of restaurants, and located close to two separate train stations with easy access to all parts of Manhattan. I would highly recommend this space!

Thank you, Mena!

This was my second stay with Mena and it was just as delightful as the first visit! She is always so hospitable and helpful, and the cozy guest quarters have everything you need from extra storage, hangers, and the the little amenities I love at hotels like mini shampoos or a hairdryer and an iron, just incase you forgot yours! ;) The location is perfect - close to Central Park and subway stations. There's a deli just downstairs that has all groceries you could need for a visit. Coffee shops and cafes are all around in the charming Upper West Side! Her apartment feels like my home away from home when I'm in NYC now. Thanks for everything Mena! Hope to see you again soon!

The description does not match the reality !!! This is a shared room and NOT a single room. It was a studio apartment divided by a curtain, with the bed in the middle of a transition zone, with no privacy!
Cleanliness was precarious.

Mena was a very friendly and accommodating host.  She insisted that I call her day or night if  I needed anything. She made me feel very welcome.  And on the rare occasion we were both home at the same time, I enjoyed our conversation! Her apartment is located in one of the best neighborhoods in NYC!

Mena was more than happy to accommodate my sister in law and aunt at very short notice. Her place was comfortable and convenient, and located in a good spot in the Upper West Side of New York City.

She's communicative and easy to deal with. A happy experience for us.

One word: Awesome! It was a great stay at Menas apartment, just a short walk to Central Park, the Metro or the next supermarket. Besides it was cozy and comfortable, we felt like being home from the very First day on, Mena was a great host. We would definitely come again for a few days, Theres nothing better than running through Central Park in the Morning.
The host canceled this reservation 39 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Mena was prompt to respond and the place was as described and shown in the pics. The neighborhood is very safe, and her apt. close to restaurants, supermarkets, and UWS action. A little noisy if you need lots of quiet to sleep. She was really kind and worrying  about nearby bar/club  noise disturbance, made me accept a return for the night of the loud music. I found the location very convenient for transportation.

Mena's apartment is lovely in a wonderful neighborhood steps from Central Park. You will want for nothing as there are hundreds of shops, restaurants and bars all within walking distance. There is even a full grocery store directly across the street! The subways are just 2 blocks away in both directions  as well as buses. The space is cozy with a great bed, TV, racks to hang clothing as well as a working kitchen to cook your own food. It is a classic NYC walk up, so don't expect modern fixtures, simply indulge in the prewar charm. Mena is a very accommodating hostess dedicated to the happiness of her guests. The room is divided by floor to ceiling curtains so there is no full sound privacy, but she has fans to cancel to noise installed. Highly recommend!

I had a wonderful stay with Mena. The space is as shown in the pics.  She's great about staying in touch-  made arrangements for me to get the keys since our schedules were different. The apartment is very close to the subway, to Central Park and to restaurants and grocery stores.  The street noise is a bit loud, but that's to be expected given the location and it's definitely worth it to be so central to everything! Mena is a gracious and accommodating hostess!

Mena was an amazing host! She left fresh towels and even made my bed. She was extremely attentive. Although we didn't meet due to our schedules, Mena was very responsive. The apartment was very zen, charming, and in a fantastic upper westside location. It was clean and in a great location near wonderful restaurants and with Central Park right down the block. I would definitely stay here again. It was great!

This was my 3rd visit staying with Mena, and I keep returning for the same wonderful reasons! She is an excellent hostess - very accommodating, great with communication, arrival and departure is always flexible and simple, and if a minor issue ever arose (ex: the wifi went out once) she took care of and had resolved promptly. Her apartment is so charming, located in my favorite neighborhood in NYC - the Upper West Side. There are coffee shops, wine bars, restaurants all around - great residential neighborhood with still plenty to do if you don't feel like getting further in to town. It's about a 3 minute walk to Central Park, the subway - you really couldn't ask for a better location. It's beginning to feel like my home away from home.
Thanks Mena! Hope to see you again soon!

Not much to say because I was literally only at the apartment when I was sleeping, BUT I still highly recommend staying at Mena's place. The location is absolutely perfect! The one time I did need a question answered, Mena was quick to respond and help. The apartment was very clean as well. I did not meet Mena due to our schedules but I would definitely book again.

I stayed at Mena's UWS apartment for 3 nights and my stay was fantastic! Despite my last minute trip to NY, everything was prepared and perfect.
Mena is very easy to communicate with and very responsive. She is friendly, attentive, flexible, and can give you some good tips on NY.
The apartment was clean and the bed was very comfortable. 
The location is excellent, right by Central Park and with a subway stop 2 blocks away. The neighborhood is nice and quiet with a residential feel to it, but with a lot of nice bars and restaurants a few blocks away.
I would definitely recommend staying at Mena's place.

Mena was fantastic. She was super helpful and answered any questions that I had. Her place was exactly what my boyfriend and I were looking for, during our short stay in NYC. The location was great and so close to Central Park. If we ever make it back to NYC we will definitely stay again. Thanks again Mena
Mena was very friendly and responsive. The location was perfect for our family wanting to spend time at Central Park, it was a 2 minute walk. We would stay here again.

The place is a typical Manhattan walk-up. No frills but really convenient location and I only needed a place to sleep so I didn't spend much time there. 

It got loud at nights because one of the bars close by has live music. Mena had some helpful suggestions on how to drown out the noise and offered to call them though, which was nice. 

In general, Mena was very responsive and I also appreciated that she sent me a heads-up anytime she needed to pick up something from her place. We didn't end up overlapping after check-in, but it was a nice gesture from her to notify me just in case I was there.
Mena was great and very accomodating.  Made us feel at home.  The location was PERFECT!

The apartment is ok. For the price we paid, we expected more. It is really small, the bathroom is not clean (moisture) and it is really noisy at night.

That being said, Mena is really kind and the location is great.

Great location just a few minutes walk from Central Park and the subway. Mena was really nice and made sure we had everything we needed. Her place is cozy and comfortable. We didn't see her much as we were out most of the time and so was she, but she was quick to answer if I had any questions about the place. The neighborhood is awesome, too! Lots of restaurants and shops. I would definitely stay here again.

O apartamento da Mena é bem gostoso, bem aconchegante e a localização impecável, próximo de duas estações de metrô, do Central Park e do museu de historia e natural, fora o bairro que é uma delícia e seguro. Ela foi super atenciosa com a gente na chegada, ela atrasou um pouco a entrega do apartamento, porém deixou a gente deixar as malas antes mesmo do combinado. Mas tivemos um pequeno desconforto durante a locação. Alugamos o apartamento inteiro, e era a primeira vez dela, ela sempre está acostumada a alugar o quarto. Então ela falou pra gente que se precisasse de roupa a mais pro trabalho, iria nos avisar com antecendência, para não nos deixar supresos. Ela foi de fato 2 vezes, avisando, porem apareceu mais 2 vezes sem nos avisar, uma pra pegar roupa e outra, na nossa vespera de saida, para arrumar para os proximos hospedes, e ainda tomou banho. Ficamos sem graça e bem surpreso. Sabemos que não foi por maldade, mas não ficamos 100% confortáveis e a vontade num apartamento, que é o espírito do Airbnb.

Mena was a great host. She's very kind, flexible, and communicative. Even though the checkout time was at 11 a.m., she was extremely open to letting me leave my luggage there till later in the day, which was much appreciated. The building got noisy at night, but overall a wonderful place to stay for a quick trip to NYC!

Mena was a terrrific host, so sweet and went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable.  We asked for recommendations on places for craft beer etc and she even walked to the places to confirm the addresses for us.  Her apartment is in a great location too.  Felt much more like home than just a room.  We will stay at Mena's place every time we come back to NYC.  Thank you Mena!

I always love staying on the Upper West Side and Mena's place is perfectly located for taking a walk in Central Park, walking to numerous restaurants, taking the subway and even hopping on the local bus for a super quick way to get to Lincoln Center, Hells Kitchen, etc.

Mena is an excellent host!
She could not have made my stay more enjoyable. I was in the city for 8 nights for work. Here are some things to know about my visit: 
1. The location is everything. The apartment is within walking distance (short and easy) from multiple subway stops, Central Park, shopping areas, great restaurants, Trader Joe's and the Museum of Natural History...the Met is right across the park as well. Mena is super knowledge about the area and recommended great food options, offered traveling advice etc. 
2. Check in and check out was simple, Mena was flexible with meeting to coordinate keys and always reachable via text/phone call if a question came up. She was also very accommodating when I added a last-minute guest to my stay.
3. The apartment is comfortable and clean. I felt like I had my own personal and private space, which I was worried about before hand because of the curtain divider described online. It was not an issue for me. On the note, Mena is quite enjoyable to live with! She made coffee and tee every morning with breakfast. Very sweet. 
Overall I enjoyed my stay very much and would 100% recommend to other Airbnb users. I will be on the look out for Mena's next time I need a place to stay in NYC.

Mena and her place were excellent. She was accommodating, generous, and welcoming, and her apartment is the prime spot to stay in the city. I loved the proximity to great food, parks, and the subway, while still being on a relatively quiet street. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

What a great little spot! Perfectly located, walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping, Central Park, and public transportation. The apartment is situated in a lovely part of the upper west side filled with fun things to do and neat shops to check out. 
The apartment itself is small but comfortable, it has everything you need for a simple trip. The bed was very comfortable and the curtains gave me plenty of privacy and comfort. 
Mena was an amazing host, super quick to respond, very flexible and constantly going above and beyond her 'duties'. I had a little trouble with the dates I had reserved the location for and she took care of it promptly and efficiently.
I would definitely chose to stay here again on my next trip to NY!

Mena is a great host.  She responds pretty quickly and she tries to make your stay as stress free as possible.  Location was great.  Less than 5 min walk to get to Central Park.  A 10 min walk to get to the subway station.  Many restaurants to pick from and easy to walk to.  I will definitely stay here again!!!

Be aware of noisy nightclub sound that travels to the apt and room is not private as described. Merely cordoned off with curtains.

Mena is one of the nicest hosts I've come across using Airbnb. In my two years, I was never offered breakfast. She was also extremely flexible with my reservation, as I had to check out a day sooner. Great communication, always available. I felt very comfortable in the apartment, it was like visiting a friend. Description is accurate. Many thanks! Until next time. -S
Such a great location! Subway Station is so close by, and the park as well! The bed was very comfortable and Mena was so accommodating with coffee in the AM and whatever else I needed!

Great location next to Central Park and lots of nice restaurants, boutiques and coffee shops down the street.

I appreciated that Mena responded to me immediately after messaging her through the Airbnb app throughout my stay if I had any questions or updates for her.

There is no elevator in the complex, so be prepared to go up 2 flights of stairs.

It's a great time in NYC! So close to the subway so you're minutes away from anything you want in Manhattan! Walking distance (literally 3 blocks) to the natural history museum, right by Central Park so if spending time there is your thing, this is a great place for it!

This is centrally located apt conveniently located around the corner from a deli/breakfast place. There is a bed surrounded by curtains, but if the host is home and you want privacy-the AC may not cool you adequately. One of the neighbors likes to play loud music at night until about midnight.

Very good location, just as advertised. However the neighbors are sometimes noisy at night (sounds like a band practice).

Mena was very nice and straightforward. I 100% recommend.

Mena is a fabulous host! I was a little nervous traveling in my own but Mena made it feel like I was just visiting a friend in the city. She was very easy to communicate with and quick to respond. The apartment is completely open, so the two sleeping areas (Mena's and yours) are just separated by curtains, but I still felt I had a lot of privacy in the space. The bed was very comfortable and I felt very safe at her place. I slept very well. It reminded me of my college days just having a roommate and that was fun if you're into that vibe. There was some noise at night from a band as others said, but it didn't bother me. I guess my long days of training and yoga practice helped me zone it out or I used it to help me sleep since it's pretty muffled and the hum of the fans in the apartment helped drown it out and clear my head. Maybe bring ear plugs or listen to something on your phone that's relaxating if you're worried about it being a bother. The "room" had towels, and was all made up and ready so I felt welcomed. Mena also bought some bottled water for me (though the tap tasted fine too). The location is amazing. Though I was in a training all day and couldn't enjoy the attractions it's so close to Central Park, American Museum of Natural History, yummy restaurants and stores. It's great and I would stay again!!

Excellent location. Excellent hostess.
Mena made my stay comfortable in every way: ease of check-in/checkout, comfortable bed, fresh towels, advice on local restaurants (so many good ones close by), and even an umbrella when it looked like rain!
This will be my "go to" when I visit NYC. I've even booked my next stay with Mena. Recommend.
I had a wonderful time at Mena's place, she was very helpful. The neighborhood was great, I would highly recommend staying at Mena's place. Thanks again for the great hospitality :)

My second time doing Air bnb in NYC and instead of rolling the dice on a new place I decided to stay with the same host again. She and her apt are great! Very close to Central Park, the subway, museums, etc.  You won’t be disappointed here.

Mena mi ha salvato da una situazione veramente complicata, dopo che la mia prenotazione in un'altra casa era stata cancellata all'ultimo momento. Nonostante sia stato tuttto organizzato poche ore prima del check-in non ho avuto nessun problema con lei. La casa è piccola ma bella e confortevole, la collocazione è buona ed il prezzo è perfetto
Mena was an amazing host, her apartment is central to subway restaurants and bars. I would definitely stay again!!

This was the third time I was here. I keep coming back because of the location (a block from Central Park, a block from a subway stop), the host (Mena is a great host and more than accommodating), and the price (relatively inexpensive for NYC). This was a work trip for a conference, but when I come back for fun I’ll be sure to look her up again!
Mena is super accommodating, especially regarding checking-in and checking-out. She's easy going and thoughtful. And the location is superb. Thanks for a great stay Mena!!

Mena was a great host. She was very responsive and hospitable. She even let me borrow her Citibike key in case I wanted to explore the city on bike and made breakfast for me one morning. Her apartment is in a terrific location and I felt like there was plenty of privacy with the curtain setup. I would stay with Mena again!
I loved staying with Mena for my short weekend stay! Perfect location and comfy bed. Thanks Mena!

Mena was amazing host, she is wonderful lady, very accommodating and easy going. She gave me lots of tips about town, transportation, dining ecc. She is great! Convenient location. Highly recommend Mena's place. Would go back!

Mena‘s place is just great and it is exactly as described on airbnb! I can’t think of a better and most awesome host as Mena is, she responds to messages prior to your stay right away and provides her guests with all relevant informations about NYC! It was my second time staying with Mena and I can’t recommend her highly enough for her outstanding hospitality and looking after me while I was staying at her place! I simply love the Upper West Side, within walking distance to Central Park, lots of restaurants around and public transportation right next door to get you anywhere in the city within no time! I’m already looking forward staying with Mena in the not so far future and really hope to be back very very soon .... I miss that comfy bed a lot! Thank you, Mena ... you are the best!!!!!
the location is amazing and Mena is a fantastic host. Will be my first choice next time I'm in NYC
Mena's place was perfect for my friend and I! large and well lit space in a great location on the Upper West Side. Close to the Park and great restauarants and bars.

Great neighborhood, so close to Central Park, restaurants, coffee shops, deli right downstairs and supermarket too! Comfortable beds. Will be staying at Mena’s again very soon. Great host, quick to respond to any requests or questions.

I really enjoyed staying with Mena. I felt so comfortable in her place. The curtains go from floor to the very high ceilings so I could have as much or as little privacy as I wanted. I was a little worried about noise from the club nearby so I brought earplugs, but I never even thought about using them.  Mena has a busy schedule too so for the most part, I felt as if I had the place to myself. The location is fantastic. Green spaces nearby, super easy subway access, and so many restaurants within a few blocks. I will definitely stay with Mena again.  Thank you Mena!

This was my 4th time here! I keep coming back because of the location and the hospitality! I love the museums (literally 5 minute walk) and Central Park (2 minute walk). Mena’s a great host, staying with her for the weekend is the absolute way to go!

P.S. the only reason I didn’t rank it better than I expected was because I knew to expect excellence being it was my fourth time here!
Everything ok

The location is great. If you just need a place for a sleep, you could choose this place with reasonable price.
However, I need a private space - at least a room with a door.  But this place cannot meet. I didn’t expect a space with just curtain separated. And plus the bathroom is quite not...clean. Maybe it’s my fault not reading carefully.  So I applied early check out and appreciated that  Mean agreed.

Mena was friendly; but sadly the apartment was ultra dirty, she arrived late (and she was surprised I arrived on time myself) and it was raining - at 9.25pm with a 15hours of travel with two flights, trust me you’re not really happy. Bed was not ready, I helped to do it (blood on the mattress) .. bathroom was suppose to be private but I had to share it with the host. Bathtub had been announced to be old. Old would have been ok: it was even more dirty.. curtains not to mention. In the morning I wanted to have some coffee : I couldn’t use microwave as there was a very old cup inside - didn’t want to go further. No WiFi as expected - no air conditioning (even if I don’t like it) the repair guy was supposed to come the day after (surprisingly) Anyway! Mena looks friendly, but I’m surprised nobody complained about the quality (clean) of this apartment. $110/night + cleaning fee is clearly not a bargain when it is that dirty and non as expected. Make a super big clean-up first and then make this apt available again. It’s humanly not possible!

This apartment is in great location to discover New York. Almost next to Central Park allows you to go jogging there in then morning (or whenever).
Mena is very warm, welcoming and helpful host!
The apartment is convenient for a single traveler or a couple who don't expect a brand new facilities.
We couldn’t have had a better experience! Mena is an incredible host and her place is the perfect location! Looking forward to coming back one day!
Mena was an outstanding host. She met me upon arrival, gave me a tour of the apt, offered excellent suggestions on where to go and what to do.  I can’t sing her praises enough.
The host canceled this reservation 50 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I turned up at West 84th Street on the day of my visit. I had previously sent Mena two messages, one two days earlier, but received no response. No one was at home. I went round the corner for a bite to eat. No one was at home again. I phoned the phone number associated with Mena's account and it was out of order. I emailed her direct, again nothing. 

I now got in touch with Airbnb in a state of confusion and panic. They tried to reach her by phone and via messaging. They could not get through. I was advised by Airbnb to seek a local hotel which I duly did after a 30 mins walk. The cost was $289. Airbnb refunded my reservation but are now saying I can only get back $100, despite not mentioning this in a previous message. 

9 days after my visit, I still have no explanation of what happened from the host. I am bitterly disappointed with this, my first experience of booking with this site.
Mena is very nice.
Mena was a kind and considerate host who went out of her way to make sure I was taken care of. Her place was very clean and is in a terrific location. I enjoyed my stay.
Great location, super comfortable bed with good privacy, clean.  Mena was very helpful arranging easy check-in and making me feel welcome.

What a great work week. Menss place is in such a great location! Better than most! If you’re in NY and want to see what a great neighborhood looks like, explore the Park and have instant access to any part of the City via Subway, this is your place! The apartment can have some “city noise” but it really ads to the authenticity and charm of this apartment. Mena makes a great cup of coffee and has clearly never met a stranger. You won’t be disappointed. Mena is the real deal, incredibly genuine and super kind. Thanks so much Mena! Until we meet again!
It was a pleasure staying with Mena! I would be happy to stay at her place again.

Overall disappointing stay. We were told to arrive later than check in and even with accommodating, we came to an unmade bed with stained sheets. However, the bed was made when we came back from dinner a few hours later. We were not given a tour, offered coffee or tea as described, or clean towels until the early morning when we were heading out to the airport. There was no wifi in the apartment as described in the listing which we were depending on to look at directions to places in the area. After coming from another airbnb with a similar price this place did not compare. The location is good for locals, however, given the price there are better accommodations for the same cost.

reviews.comments: Apartment is clean and modern and functional. Everything provided including linen and even soap toothbrush and paste. Very happy and good value so extended my stay. Thanks Rita

name: Large 4 Bed house near Blue Mountains and Sydney
summary: Four bedroom house with tenant living in granny flat in back garden near back of house. Tenant has side access and access through front drive but large gate between granny flat and house. House has upstairs bathroom and downstairs toilet. House set on 900 square meter plot with parking for 3 card and electric gate. Beautiful view of blue mountains from back of house and 20 meter back garden. Reverse cycle air conditioner in double master (Website hidden by Airbnb) burner and plenty of wood available.

Tenant has side access and access through front drive but large gate between granny flat and house. House has upstairs bathroom and downstairs toilet. Reverse cycle air conditioner in double master (Website hidden by Airbnb) burner and plenty of wood available.

host.host_about:
My wife and my two children have lived in this house for 3 years and have renovated the house quite considerably. The kitchen and dining room has been renovated and also the lounge. We are going to UK and Europe for 5 weeks would love to have someone living in the house for that time

Peter and Qian

name: MACON MEMORIES..** WINTER SPECIAL***
summary: Restored Brownstone in a thriving Brooklyn neighborhood, everything close by, 15 minutes to the city by subway, 10 minutes to Barclay Center, 30 min to airports, JFK or LQA,  Entire floor is yours!!!
space: Beautifully furnished, quality linens, fully equipped kitchen,  Garden views from the kitchen. Pack and Play crib available. The unit is on the garden level of the brownstone and the private entrance has one flight of stairs, not handicap accessible. Digital keys are available once booking is confirmed. The bedroom is private and has a queen size bed with a sitting area for reading or just enjoying the view from the front of the tree lined quiet block, this room has a marble fireplace (non working) with a flat screened smart TV with streaming media on SLING TV.  There is also a desk/workspace to plug in a laptop or write notes. The open living room area has a full sized sofa bed and can sleep 2. This room is open to the galley kitchen which is outfitted with stainless steel appliances, stone countertops and fully equipped with dishes and cookware, if you will like to cook. The dining area is located in this area next to another marble fireplace and seats 4.  There are 2 comfy chairs an

Beautifully furnished, quality linens, fully equipped kitchen,  Garden views from the kitchen. Pack and Play crib available. The unit is on the garden level of the brownstone and the private entrance has one flight of stairs, not handicap accessible. Digital keys are available once booking is confirmed. The bedroom is private and has a queen size bed with a sitting area for reading or just enjoying the view from the front of the tree lined quiet block, this room has a marble fireplace (non working) with a flat screened smart TV with streaming media on SLING TV.  There is also a desk/workspace to plug in a laptop or write notes. The open living room area has a full sized sofa bed and can sleep 2. This room is open to the galley kitchen which is outfitted with stainless steel appliances, sto
neighborhood_overview: We are located on a quiet, tree-lined street in the heart of the beautiful, safe, and culturally vibrant Stuyvesant Heights Historic District of Brooklyn, New York (which, along with its sister community of Bedford, is commonly referred to by the amalgamated name “Bedford-Stuyvesant” or “Bed-Stuy”). Brooklyn, of course, is the true cultural center of New York City, or, as GQ has rightfully called it, “the coolest City on the Planet”
notes: Just 15 minutes to NYC, by A/C subway or buses, only 2 minute walk from home.  10 minutes to Barclay Center and downtown Brooklyn/DUMBO.  Located in historic Stuyvesant Heights. 2 blocks from Fulton which has banking, dining, food and clothing/misc shopping and there are fabulous brunch and dinner restaurants and lounges all within walking distance.  I'll provide a list of suggestions with addresses when you check in.
transit: There is an abundance of public transportation with subways located only 2 blocks away, bus lines at the corner of the block, as well as NYC Taxi, UBER, LYFT, Private car and street hails livery readible available.
access: Free WiFi,  private entrances, private kitchen and bath, private bedroom. Entire floor is private
interaction: Private stay, I don't share the space. I am available for any questions as I reside in the building on another floor.
house_rules: - Quiet after 11PM HOUSE RULES: NO smoking indoors. Turn off lights, fan, TV, iron, radios and air conditioners and blow out candles before leaving. If it looks like rain, close windows. The only thing that goes in the toilet is toilet paper- no “wet wipes”, etc. When cooking, use exhaust fan located on microwave. Recycle all metal, glass and hard plastic. RINSE OUT FIRST! You may empty the garbage in the front area of the building, do not put on the curb. Do not leave food out exposed. Wash all cooking items. Be considerate of the other occupants by keeping the noise down.  NO parties, NO unauthorized guests day or night, NO visitors, please remove shoes.  Do not slam doors.   Be happy!

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: A Brooklyn Native! I love NY and my city of Brooklyn.  I live in a beautifully restored brownstone on a classic tree lined block.  I love entertaining and hosting comes natural, I would love to welcome you to my City and help make your visit an awesome experience, I'm full of hints and can recommend some great spots to ensure you have a fabulous visit!

reviews.comments: If you have a chance , stay here !!! It’s was absolutely perfect , from the location to the eatery’s , close proximity to subway . The quiet street to the wonderful wine store two blocks away . I can’t say enough about it , from the moment I walked in I felt safe at home and needed for nothing , The communication was excellent , hospitality was endearing and thoughtful . I will stay here again ! One last shout out to Brooklyn KOOL PLACE!!!!
The host canceled this reservation 52 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

What an amazing experience! "Macon Memories" is such a well thought out and well executed space, when I walked in the door I told Adelle I could live there. Communication was super easy.  Adelle was very responsive from booking, to check-in, during my stay and even as I was leaving.  Best location for me.  I needed to mainly be in Brooklyn.  I have stayed in that neighborhood before, so only being a few short blocks to the train was key.  I felt safe, even as a single woman at night, no worries.  The building is secured with 2 locked doors before your private entrance.  The (Website hidden by Airbnb) bright, so clean, everything brand new...I christened several kitchen items, loved that.  If you plan to cook, not to worry, all you need to bring is food.  I mean she has everything!  I do protein shakes every morning, but what were the chances I would find a blender there??  I did find one, it was there...big bonus!  The furnishings were cute, and modern, tastefully decorated, the bed was cozy and comfy, I slept like a baby every night.  I spent time enjoying every room like I was in my own apartment.  Plenty of storage space in closets, hangers, luggage racks, which I love...I was able to hide my belongings so the place didn't look cluttered.  I am a clean freak and the apartment was spotless.  It really looks like the pictures, #nofilter!  I already told Adelle I will be returning soon, so all you people out there, you better book it before I do if you feel like "Macon Memories"!!

Staying with adelle was wonderful! This was my first time traveling to New York and it was amazing. The place is close to public transit, lots of food places nearby and things to do. The hospitality we received from adelle was amazing. From the bottle of wine, snacks, the packet (that was so helpful) of things to do nearby and public transit etc. she honestly thought of everything. also, the place was very stylish and clean. Hands down the best bnb I have stayed in. The next time I travel to New York I will definately be staying here.

Adelle is a perfect host! 
We were warmly welcome in her beautiful brownstone home. We felt instantly like home and we was happy to come back in late evening in this wonderful cocoon. We slept very well in the gorgeous bed.
The street is great and safe and parking was easy. 
Perfect for a family of 4, two couples or friends! 
Thanks you for everything Adelle. The girls and I definitively want to come back.
Marie, Laura, Ève and Aurélie!
Adelle was very accommodating & helpful. The apartment is beautiful, clean, and in a great location.

For our first time in NYC Adelle's house was perfect. The neighborhood is nice and safe, close to public transports, shops and supermarkets. The house is a beautiful brownstone in a nice street. 
The appartement is very clean, nicely decorated with full equipments for kitchen, bedroom and bathroom (dishes, bedsheets, towels, shampoo...)
Adelle was a great and caring host (thanks for the bottle of wine, candies and guestbook with recommandations). It was nice to meet her the day we arrived.
We will definitly recommand Macon Memories to our friends and family.
De las mejores experiencias súper recomendable
The most comfy bed, quiet Brooklyn retreat, easy to get around! Full kitchen, gorgeous neighborhood! Adelle is perfectly attentive and available.

What a wonderful place in Brooklyn.  Adelle did an amazing job making our stay extra special.  Everything was clean and as indicated in the listing.  Macon Memories is located close to shopping, food and the subway.  We had a wonderful time visiting my son- we will definitely be back!

This place exceeded my expectations. It looks exactly like the pictures but even better. 

Adelle had a comprehensive list of recommendations and was available should we need her. 

Really really special stay. Can’t say enough good things.

We stayed 10 days in this wonderful Brooklyn Appartment. And we enjoyed it , returning home from our footrace around New York City every day and night . We ran in Prospekt Park in the morning and enjoyed a nice shower at this very clean and well equipped place. Close to Kingston Troop subway and situated in a very lively but save neighborhood. We bought our foodstuff at the deli , just down the corner and    our groceries etc at the grocery shop at 1310 Fulton Steet (Think it is the right adress). We also went to Williamsburg, nice place. And to close by Rock away Beach for a swim. We highly recommend this lovely place and its nice hosts Mark and Adelle . Thank you Both Don’t forget the concerts in Prospekt Park , during summertime❤️Love Margrethe , Liv and Jan from Svendborg, Denmark
I just wanna summarize my impressions: Everything is perfect. Adelle is friendly, polite and helpful. Highly recommended.

Great place!!! It's extremely clean and decorated super cute! The bed is super comfy and everything is close by. The subway is only two blocks away from the home for quick access to get on the subway. Adelle was great and super nice! Definitely will go back!

Adelle’s place was wonderful and the price was great to MYC. Getting around was easy. Subway stop is very close plus we used Lyft a few times for a good price. The place was very clean and full of special touches. Kitchen and the apartment were very well equipped. Everything you may need is there. This place is close to grocery stores and restaurants. Adelle and her family were  very helpful  and quick to respond when needed.  We would defiantly stay here again and highly recommend you stay  here.
we loved our stay at the appartment. it is located in a great neighbourhood of Brooklyn and in a short distance to the subway. we will come back!
We had a wonderfull time at your (Website hidden by Airbnb) was perfect.I should regament it absolutly.Thanks.Fam Cobelens from Holland.

Appartement parfait. Très propre très bien équipé et très agréable. Décoration moderne. 
Adelle est vraiment accueillante. 

Bien placé pour visiter New York et Brooklyn avec accès métro en 5 minutes.

Perfect place to stay. Apartment was charming and cozy and in great proximity to the subway. Adelle did a great job and providing tips and tricks in navigating the city, and had an abundant amount of suggestions for food and sightseeing. Will definitely stay here again!

We had a great time at Adelle's place. She was very responsive to any issues that came up like when the air conditioner did not work . It got fixed promptly. The location was great -just 2 blocks away from the subway. A lot of great restaurants and grocery stores nearby too!

Adelle’s place was impeccably clean, tastefully decorated, and thoughtfully designed. The guest manual is filled with helpful local tips. Also, I found the speaker and the blender to be really nice touches. I had an absolutely amazing stay and I would definitely recommend!
Great apartment in Brooklyn. Close to public transportation and 25 minutes to manhatten. Highly recommended!
Adelle was such a great host and her apartment is beautiful, tidy, and very clean! She was really easy to communicate in and we appreciated her tips. Would definitely recommend!
La vivienda es fantástica. Bien amueblada y muy limpia. El emplazamiento es muy bueno, en una bonita calle y muy cerca de metro . Adelle es muy buena anfitriona y muy detallista. Lo recomendaremos.

Adelle's place was BEAUTIFUL. High ceiling height (yes, I notice these things) and great location. It was spotless and Adelle even gave us a bottle of wine to share! She was extremely communicative and helped us answer any questions we may have. If you are looking for a place to stay in New York, Adelle's place (which is in Brooklyn) is quiet, near the subway (C train), and affordable.
Nothing but the best
This place was great! Adelle was super sweet and quick to respond.  We had a great stay!

It was my first time in NY and Adelle's place helped a lot. Perfect apartment. Very close to subway (less than 5min walking), delis, bars, restaurants, and stores at Fulton St. Very silent for a 1st floor apartment; Adelle is available at all times. 
The neighborhood is amazing and i'm sure this Brooklyn experience it's what made me like NY the most. Will sure stay there again on our next visit to NY. Thanks!

This is a beautifully decorated apartment in a townhome. There are  thoughtful touches to the Airbnb that make it feel like home. The host was wonderful and really helpful. She  was also really good at communicating.

Adelle’a place is AMAZING. Warm, well designed and very inviting. There’s a lot to explore in the neighborhood but the apartment is so cozy you may not want to leave. Adelle was prompt in responses and we felt she truly cared about our experience at her home. Can’t recommend this place enough!

Adelle’s apartment is absolutely lovely. It has everything you’ll need for your trip. We used the kitchen to make multiple meals and it was fully equipped with everything we needed. I especially appreciated the two large closets, hangers, and luggage racks to unpack as I dislike having to live out of a suitcase. The apartment itself is clean and charming and you’ll instantly feel at home when you walk in.

Adelle’s Place is Amazing! Communication was on point . She was not able to greet me but was able to buzz me in by phone because I’m no techie when it comes to all these apps. She also gave me her daughters info for a backup. The apartment was so peaceful which was what we needed because we were in town for a funeral of a relative. Will definitely try and book with Adelle whenever I’m in Brooklyn. Also if you’re driving in we found parking only a few doors down!

name: Coastal renovated family home in Vaucluse
summary: Contemporary north facing home in the heart of Vaucluse that is bright,airy with plenty of light and privacy. 3 story house with plenty of accommodation and entertaining zones. Consists of 3 bedrooms, 3 full bathrooms,kitchen with all the modern conveniences, dining table for 10,large lounge leading to a deck.Bottom floor is a play/tv room leading to the bbq and backyard with an outdoor shower with hot/cold water. full laundry with additional toilet. Bus stop outside takes u to Bondi beach.
space: This beautiful quiet bright north facing home is very relaxed and comfortable, making it a perfect home for holidays.  Lovely garden with outdoor hot/ cold shower and trampoline Situated near a bus stop means you have access to everything right from your doorstep. Or if you prefer you can walk many of the coastal walks taking you to Watson’s bay or Bondi beach and beyond. Short stroll to shops and cafes.

neighborhood_overview: Vaucluse is located right near all the beautiful coastal walks. 30 min stroll to Bondi beach or 20 to Watson’s bay. L
transit: There is a bus stop right outside which takes u straight to Bondi beach or Bondi junction. Walking around this area is beautiful as there are so many beaches to discover that are only accessible by foot.
